result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard C Boucher Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Richard C Boucher in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, but read in to case 14CM4174.
Received and Filed, Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Richard C Boucher in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter request case be set for a Plea & Sentencing date in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: THERESA K.
Oral No Violent Contact Ordered with: Joseph B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard C Boucher in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Richard C Boucher in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to lower pending case 14CM4174.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
